what: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: bSantiago data package results 2016 survey conducted Santiago, Chile, designed study health psychological status residents city respect daily commuting/travel experience. survey provides data examine feelings values respect active motorized modes transportation.

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: can install development version Santiago GitHub :

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016

what: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: data package based paper-based survey conducted face--face Santiago 2016. goal Santiago contribute psychological impacts travelers examining feelings stress users active motorized modes transportation.Furthermore, also investigates importance travelers attach feelings stress.package contains different datasets namely Individual characteristics (IC), Health (H), Feelings emotions (FE), Reason planning decision (RPD), Social interaction (SI), Nature sustainability (NS), ITC shifting (), Build environment(), Traveling work (TW).

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: https://github.com/NiloofarNL/Santiago

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: Niloofar Nalaee, School Earth, Environment Society, McMaster University nalaeen@mcmaster.ca

title: A data frame with information about the build environment near the place of residence of respondents to the survey — Santiago_BE
text: face face survey considering pre-census 2012

title: A data frame with information about the build environment near the place of residence of respondents to the survey — Santiago_BE
text: @format data frame 451 rows 22 variables: r7AA_AUTOSPACE respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Space cars r7AB_PARKING_NUMB respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Amount parking spaces r7AC_QHIWAY respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Quality highways r7AD_PEDESTRN respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Space pedestrians r7AE_QSIDEWA respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Quality sidewalks r7AF_CLEAN_STOP respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Cleaningness bus stops r7AG_SEAT respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Sitting areas bus stops r7AH_CLIMA respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Weather protection bus stops r7AI_CICLEWA_NUMB respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Amount cycleways r7AJ_CICLEWA_Q respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Quality cycleways r7AK_BICSHARE respondents evaluate following aspects near home? Bike sharing schemes r7BA_IMPAUTOSPACE respondents rate level importance : Space cars r7BB_IMPPARKING_NUMB respondents rate leve importance : Amount parking spaces r7BC_IMPQHIWAY respondents rate leve importance : Quality highways r7BD_IMPPEDESTRN respondents rate leve importance : Space pedestrians r7BE_IMPQSIDEWA respondents rate leve importance : Quality sidewalks r7BF_IMPCLEAN_STOP respondents rate leve importance : Cleaningness bus stops r7BG_IMPSEAT respondents rate leve importance : Sitting areas bus stops r7BH_IMPCLIMA respondents rate leve importance : Weather protection bus stops r7BI_IMPCICLEWA_NUMB respondents rate leve importance : Amount cycleways r7BJ_IMPCICLEWA_Q respondents rate leve importance : Quality cycleways r7BK_IMPBICSHARE respondents rate leve importance : Bike sharing schemes

title: A data frame with information about the build environment near the place of residence of respondents to the survey — Santiago_BE

title: A data frame with information about the feelings and emotions of respondents to the survey — Santiago_FE
text: @format data frame 451 rows 22 variables: r2AA_FREEDOM indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Freedom r2AB_UNSAFETY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Unsafety r2AC_FUNCTIONALITY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Functionality r2AD_ENJOYMENT indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Enjoyment r2AE_LOWCOST indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Low cost r2AF_POVERTY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Poverty r2AG_SAFETY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Safety r2AH_WASTE_OF_TIME indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Waste time r2AI_UNPUNCTUALITY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Unpunctuality r2AJ_CONGEST indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Congestion r2AK_EFFICIENCY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Efficiency r2AL_LUXURY indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Luxury r2AM_ENVIRONMENT indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Environmental care r2AN_HEALTH indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Health r2AO_INTSOCI indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Social Interaction r2AP_UNCOMFT indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Uncomfort r2AQ_HAPPINESS indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Happiness r2AR_STATUS indicatation modes transport respondents relate following feelings concepts: Status r2B_DAILY_ENJOY much respondents usually enjoy traveling daily activities? r2C_IMP_QUALITY level importance respondents attribute quality trips? r2D_AFFECT affect travel experience? r2E_FACILIT help respondents travel experience?

title: A data frame with information about the feelings and emotions of respondents to the survey — Santiago_FE

title: A data frame with information about the health of respondents to the survey — Santiago_H
text: @format data frame 451 rows 12 variables: r1A_STRESS respondents assess level stress experience usual trips? r1B_EFFORT respondents assess physical effort make travels? r1C_PROXIMITY respondents assess level proximity (proximity) transport users usual trips? r1D_CONTAM respondents assess level environmental pollution experience usual trips? r1E_SAFETY respondents assess level safety (assaulted harassed) experience usual trips? r1F_COMFORT respondents assess level comfort experience usual trips? r1GA_STRESS importance respondents assign aspects? Levels stress r1GB_EFFORT importance respondents assign aspects? Levels physical effort r1GC_PROXIMITY importance respondents assign aspects? Levels proximity transport users r1GD_CONTAM importance respondents assign aspects? Levels (perceived) air pollution r1GE_SAFETY importance respondents assign aspects? Levels safety r1GF_COMFORT importance respondents assign aspects? Levels comfort

A data frame with socio-demographic information of respondents to the survey — Santiago_IC
text: data frame 451 rows 23 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent ORIGIN Origin travel r0A_COMMUNE Commune residence r0B_MACR_ZONE Macro area residence r0B_STREET_1 Intersections close home r0B_STREET_2 Intersections close home r0C_GENDER Gender respondents Santiago 2016 r0D_AGE Age respondents Santiago 2016 r0E_WEIGHT Weight respondents Santiago 2016 r0F_HEIGHT Height respondents Santiago 2016 r0G_EDUCATION Level education respondents Santiago 2016 r0H_OCCUPATION Occupation respondents Santiago 2016 r0I_COM_TRAB_1 Communes perform work/studies/regular trips r0I_COM_TRAB_2 Communes perform work/studies/regular trips r0J_INCOME Level income respondents Santiago 2016 r0K_ADULTS Number adults living home r0L_CHILDREN Number children iving home r0N_DRIVING_LICENSE driving licence r0M_DISABILITY disable r0O_TYPE_DIS Type disability r0P_MODE1 Main transport mode used respondents Santiago 2016 r0Q_MODE2 Secondary transport mode used respondents Santiago 2016 r0R_MODE3 transport mode add used respondents Santiago 2016

text: face face survey considering pre-census 2012

title: A data frame with information about the telecommunication and shifting different modes of travel by respondents to the survey — Santiago_IS
text: @format data frame 451 rows 9 variables: r6A_SHIFT respondents shift transport modes usual trips? r6B_QUALITY_SHIFT YES previous question, quality interchanges? r6CA_WAITING respondents assess regular trips terms : Waiting times r6CB_TIME_SHIFT respondents assess regular trips terms : Time shifts r6CC_TOTALTIME respondents assess regular trips terms : Travel time r6D_DIFFICULTY main aspect makes shifts difficult? r6E_TOOL respondents access technology tools smartphones internet, can view information transportation services? r6F_INFO assess level technological information available see transportation alternatives? (eg smartphone applications, internet, signs) r6G_IMP_INFO important respondents access technological information usual trips?

title: A data frame with information about the telecommunication and shifting different modes of travel by respondents to the survey — Santiago_IS

title: A data frame with information about the nature and sustainability from the viewpoint of respondents to the survey — Santiago_NS
text: face face survey considering pre-census 2012

title: A data frame with information about the nature and sustainability from the viewpoint of respondents to the survey — Santiago_NS
text: @format data frame 451 rows 10 variables: r5A_CHANGE climatic event like heavy rain flood, respondents change main mode transport? r5B_CHANGE_MODE respondents answered yes (change mode transport weather event), indication mode(s) required r5C_SUST respondents assess access currently available sustainable modes transport? (eg hybrid buses, electric cars, public bicycles) r5D_IMP_SUST important respondents access sustainable modes transport? r5E_PAYMENT respondents willing spend transportation gain access sustainable modes? r5F_PAYMENTS respondents' previous response positive, indication much transportation expense increase: r5GA_TREE indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Presence trees r5GB_PARK indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Access parks r5GC_MODE indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Access sustainable transport modes r5GD_MODE indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Broaden supply sustainable transport modes

title: A data frame with information about the nature and sustainability from the viewpoint of respondents to the survey — Santiago_NS

title: A data frame with information about the reason and planning decision of respondents to the survey — Santiago_RPD
text: @format data frame 451 rows 23 variables: r3A_ACCESS respondents assess access employment opportunities public transport? r3B_ACC_EM access public transport allows access employment need? r3CA_FAM often respondents perform activities? Visiting family friends r3CB_REC often respondents perform activities? Recreational activities r3CC_CUL often respondents perform activities? Cultural activities r3CD_SPO often respondents perform activities? Sport activities r3CE_GROC often respondents perform activities? Grocery/Food shopping r3CF_SOC often respondents perform activities? Social activities r3DA_FAM importance respondents assign aspects? Visiting family friends r3DB_REC importance respondents assign aspects? Recreational activities r3DC_CUL importance respondents assign aspects? Cultural activities r3DD_SPO importance respondents assign aspects? Sport activities r3DE_GROC importance respondents assign aspects? Grocery/Food shopping r3DF_SOC importance respondents assign aspects? Social activities r3E_OPTIONS important respondents consider several options use different modes transport? r3F_ACCESS_DEPENDENCY much respondents' quality life depend access respondents currently public transport? r3G_QUALITY_INCRS much respondents think quality life increase better access public transport? r3H_ECON transport modes affordable respondents family? r3I_NOECON transport modes economically unaffordable? r3JA_OFIC important improve following aspects public transport system? Improve access offices comerccial areas r3JB_MODES important improve following aspects public transport system? Improve disponibility different transport modes r3JC_COMFORT important improve following aspects public transport system? Improve comfort use public transport r3JD_OTHERS important improve following aspects public transport system? Incorporate modes fare system

title: A data frame with information about the reason and planning decision of respondents to the survey — Santiago_RPD

what: bSantiago: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — bSantiago-package
title: bSantiago: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — bSantiago-package
text: dataset containing information socio-demographics, health-related, perceptions travel behaviour, travel choices planning, social interaction factors, built environment users active motorized modes transportation.
